full_summary:
======================================
**Government Tender Announcement**
======================================

**Tender Reference:** WS4362920342
**Title:** Chiller and Condenser Supply to Environment and Climate Change Canada (ECCC)
**Procurement Method:** Competitive Bidding
**Published Date:** January 11, 2024

**Summary:**
The government is seeking offers from qualified vendors to supply and deliver chillers and condensers to Environment and Climate Change Canada (ECCC) at the Canada Centre for Inland Waters (CCIW) in Burlington, Ontario.

**Key Details:**

* **Closing Date:** February 13, 2024, 2:00 PM EST
* **Bidding System:** Offers must be submitted electronically through the Ariba Discovery platform.
* **Scope of Work:** Supply and delivery of chillers and condensers to ECCC.
* **Evaluation Criteria:** Lowest Price

**Related Documents:**

* CanadaBuys posting
* Ariba Discovery posting response
* Amendment to closing time

**Contact Information:**
For inquiries, please contact:
Jason Scott, Procurement Officer
Scott, Jason (SPAC/PSPC)
jason.scott@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca

**Note:**
All bids submitted after the closing date and time will be considered non-responsive.

**Complementary Documentations:**
None available at this time.

**Trade Agreements:**
This tender is open to vendors that hold one of the following trade agreements with the Government of Canada:
* Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP)
* Canada-Ukraine Free Trade Agreement (CUFTA)
* Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
* Canada-UK Trade Continuity Agreement (Canada-UK TCA)
* Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA)
* Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement (CPFTA)
* Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA)
* Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA)
* World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA) [1]  

Please note that errors in translation may be introduced during the processing of documentation and translation. and some information might be clapped out during document processing.
[1] Links to access the documentation of the mentioned agreements: Trade Agreement Documents Link for further information or contact for the office for Trade Agreement
